critique: This document is an executive order approving a Code of Fair Competition for the Can Manufacturers Industry under the National Industrial Recovery Act of 1933. This act was part of Franklin D. Roosevelt's New Deal program. The document reflects a strong interventionist approach to economic regulation, typical of the New Deal era. It also shows a tendency towards federal control, as the federal government is approving and enforcing industry-wide codes of conduct. There is no direct impact on immigration, executive power, national security, or social inclusion. The ideological tilt is clearly liberal, given the context of the New Deal and its focus on government intervention in the economy.
